page.title: 08APLEY HALL, STOCKTON
page.content: THIS IS A LARGE 3-STOREYED MANSION IN GOTHIC STYLE, BUILT FOR THOMAS WHITMORE, IN GRINSHILL STONE, IN 1811 AND INCORPORATING AN EARLIER GEORGIAN HOUSE.THERE WAS AN EARLIER HOUSE WITH A LICENCE TO CRENALLATE IN 13O8,NOTHING REMAINS,WAS A HALF-TIMBERED BUILDING.THE SUCCEEDING HOUSE WAS DISMANTLED IN THE CIVIL WAR. THE HOUSE WAS ENLARGE BY THE WHITMORE FAMILY.ITS SOUTH FRONT IS MAGNIFICENT WITH SUPERB VIEWS TOWARDS THE RIVER SEVERN.THE EXTERIOR IS ADORNED BY CASTELLATED WALLS,TOWERS AND TURRETS AND A FLASE CHAPEL FRONTAGE.TO THE WEST OF THE FRONTAGE IS A PRETTY ORANGERY WHICH WAS ADDED IN 1934 AND IS NOW A SWIMMING POOL.THE INTERIOR ROOMS ARE LARGE & CONTAIN FINE PLASTER CEILINGS WITH GOTHIC RIBBING.IN ITS HEYDAY THIS HOUSE AND ITS GROUNDS MUST HAVE BEEN MAGNIFICENT.
